FuncDef:
The esi command configures an Ethernet Segment Identifier (ESI).
The undo esi command deletes an ESI.
By default, no ESI is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an ESI.
The value is in the format of xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx, where x is a hexadecimal integer ranging from 0 to F. The value of esi must start with 00 but cannot be all 0s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
EVPN defines a unique ESI for connections between multiple PEs connecting to a CE. PEs' interfaces connecting to the same CE have the same ESI, and PEs' interfaces connecting to different CEs have different ESIs. PEs exchange routes that carry the ESI so that a PE can discover other PEs connecting to the same CE as itself.
Precautions
Because an ESI uniquely identifies a connection to a CE, configuring the same ESI on a PE is not recommended.
